story:
We all know we're experiencing a crisis "unprecedented in our lifetime." As a country, and at a global scale, we're scrambling for solutions. Please join our efforts to support the production and provision of clinically-effective

LOW COST VENTILATORS

UPDATE: We’re privileged to announce with your continued support VentLife was able to submit our pre-EUA documents to the FDA this weekend. Stay tuned for what we have ahead! 

I'm Elliot - I received a call from UCLA's Jennifer McCaney (executive director of their BioDesign program) and Glen Meyerowitz, an engineer at graduate school at UCLA who spent 5 years as a rocket scientist at Space X, and we knew, with the experience in our networks that we had to be doing something in response to the (unnecessary) suffering being caused by Coronavirus.

We've founded Ventlife.org, a non-profit, to prototype, produce and provide low cost ventilators to address this emergency until someone tells us to stop. 

I'm no stranger to urgent healthcare projects for people in need - I've been involved in projects that created social robot ducks for kids with cancer across the U.S. I've produced projects that sent a team to Sudan to 3D-print prosthetic limbs for child victims of war, that enabled a farmer with ALS/Motor Neurone Disease to communicate independently via ocular recognition technology and I introduced an Eye-Examination App called PEEK to a brand (Sony) to help cure blindness around the globe (one of IndieGogo's most successful healthcare fundraising efforts ever).

Though all these projects were important, and inspired other behaviors that benefited humanity, never have I been involved in a project that could save lives in real time. 

 

There is a dire need for more ventilators.

Partnerships between Ford&GE, GM&Ventec and Tesla&Medtronic in the United States are answering the call and ramping up production, and various universities like MIT, Rice & UFL are engaged in innovating in the hopes that each can help. This is all great. And more is necessary.

Coronavirus patients in critical care often need to stay on ventilators for 2 weeks and even our biggest hospitals might be lucky to have 200 units on hand. The numbers are not pretty. The GM ventilators will cost the government about $16,000 each, other existing full-feature ventilators cost $30,000 to $50,000 each. That means:-

$1 million currently funds way less than 100 ventilators.

So - What if we could raise $1 - 2 million to prototype & provide 1,000+ life-saving ventilators.

That is our goal. 

It's also just our starting line.

Clinicians in this innovative country shouldn't have to choose who will live and who will die based on limited resources.

 

What We Need 

Due to severely limited resources, strained healthcare workers are currently triaging care to select which patients will live and which will die. We aim to provide lifesaving equipment to clinicians so they never need to make such choices again and so they can properly perform their jobs.

The UCLA team with whom we're collaborating is working at speed to finish its prototype. Fortunately, the university has a simulation lab on campus at which we can do testing. With the consultation of doctors working on the front lines of COVID-19 care, the team is constantly tweaking and testing.

Cost

The estimates we've received from potential production partners is that it will take several hundred thousand dollars to take Glen's prototype at UCLA from a test model to a clinically relevant product.  We're hoping this campaign can raise enough funds for at least the first 100 ventilators and set-up the tooling, machining and sourcing necessary to create the ventilators on an ongoing basis. 
 

A clinically effective ventilator

produced by known medical device manufacturers

at around $1,000

would be a game changer.

 

From our modeling and the public numbers available, we know we can have a meaningful impact even if we're able to fund the production of just 600 - 2000 ventilators. You can help us get this into production.

PRESS COVERAGE

 

TIME Magazine - https://time.com/5812678/ventilator-innovations...

MedGadget - Low-Cost Ventilator from Home Depot Components: Interview with Glen Meyerowitz, UCLA Biodesign Fellow

Spectrum News: UCLA Engineering Grad Student Makes Ventilator, Hopes to Get It on Market

Los Angeles Business Journal: Medical Companies Quickly Pivoting

CBS: UCLA Student Develops Ventilator from Home Depot Parts

NBC4 LOS ANGELES: Grad Student Builds Ventilator Using Home Depot Supplies

NBC6 MIAMI 

NBC7 SAN DIEGO: Breast Pumps, Sleep Apnea Machines - Ventilator Shortage Spurs Innovation

CGTN America : CGTN Speaks to Ventlife

Design World: Hack the Crisis: Low-cost ventilator initiative will address COVID-19 issues

98.1 THE BREEZE - iHeartRadio with Tony Sandoval

UCLA Health: UCLA Biodesign Fellow Builds Low Cost Ventilator Prototype In Less Than a Week

TechNation: COVID-19 News Reports Lead UCLA Biodesign Fellow to Hardware Store and Innovative Ventilator Design

GineersNow: UCLA Engineer Made a Ventilator from Hardware Items

Risks & Challenges

We know there's a bumpy highway ahead. We have to get important things done and we have to move quickly. We're trying to stay ahead of it by taking calls with FDA (Food & Drug Administration) advisors and NIH (National Institute of Health) officials. We're also speaking with ISO13485 (certified) medical device manufacturing shops to ensure, as much as possible, that what we'll be sending out to the world will be a robust, effective device that can be used confidently by doctors and respiratory therapists to help people breathe.

The Team

We've got an INCREDIBLE TEAM of collaborators from various institutions to tackle the project, weigh the risks and prepare for the challenges:

Alan Crunkleton - a double-doctor (MD, PhD) and entrepreneur in the medical device sector

Elliot V. Kotek - Ventlife's Executive Director and a 4-time SxSW Innovation Awards-winner. Former Kellogg Innovation Network Fellow at The Kellogg School of Management (Northwestern University), Elliot has had projects on the TIME magazine list of year's best inventions and has work archived at the Museum of Modern Art. He's a distinguished alumnus of Australia's Monash University (Science and Law) 

Glen Meyerowitz - former SpaceX engineer and Yale University graduate, and a graduate student at UCLA Samueli School of Engineering

Jason Kleinhenz - a biomedical engineer working in quality and reverse engineering. He has also built two companies and worked in research for several years (currently working with Exact Metrology in Cincinnati, Ohio) 

Jennifer McCaney - Executive Director of UCLA's BioDesign program, Assistant Professor at the UCLA David Geffen School of Medicine and lecturer at UCLA's Anderson School of Management

Laleh Jalilian - Doctor of Anesthesiology at UCLA's Ronald Reagan Medical Center

Matthew Savary - an MD who was Director of Medical Affairs at the medical device manufacturer Medtronic and now Principal of New Ventures at UCLA's Innovation Fund

Noah Aptekar - a former technical project manager and cost analyst at SpaceX, previously leading strategic economic development initiatives at the Governor's Office for the State of Colorado! Noah's a Yale University MBA and did his undergraduate degree at the University of Pennsylvania

Patrick Daly - an MD and graduate of the US Naval Academy, Patrick is a clinical and invasive cardiologist with a background in medical device innovation and completed his cardiology training at the University of Cincinnati

Pradnya Parulekar - 13+ years of medical device manufacturing, currently with Phillips-Medisize

Sarma Singam - an MD / cardiology fellow in Louisville, Kentucky. His background is in biomedical engineering and cardiovascular diseases with a focus on cardiac critical care

Varun Yarabarla - Anesthesiology Research Fellow, former Fulbright Scholar, a medical student with a degree in Biomedical Engineering from the Georgia Institute of Technology.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know times are tough for a lot of people right now. We're all trying to get through it as sanely and safely as possible, and also trying to ensure no-one dies unnecessarily. So, please, even if you can't contribute personally, please share our campaign - get the word out. The better we are at raising funds, the more units we can produce, test and provide to people in California and around the country at this critical time.  

If we don't reach our goal, monies raised will still go toward the purchase of as many lower cost ventilators or other research and development as is deemed meaningful in that precise moment to best support our healthworkers at this time. 

Please do what you can, with what you have, wherever you are! 

(Thank you!)

story:
WHO WE ARE

My name is Bridger Buller.  In the last two years I have gained traction on a great idea that was inspired by the my parents' work.  They are have both home health nurses.  A few years ago it was really bothering them that they were having trouble getting their patients to eat. You see, as we age, we lose the taste buds needed to enjoy a wide array of foods.  This is often coupled with a diminished sense of smell, and sometimes an inability to swallow whole foods. What would result would be a home bound person that became malnourished and sick. Often their patients who were experiencing these conditions would become depressed.  

It was hard for my parents  to sit back and watch it get worse.  The patients quickly grew tired of the vegetable oil based nutritional drinks that are often utilized for poor appetite because of the metallic sugary taste.  My parents started mixing the drinks with ice cream to make a “shake” that was better received by the patients and that was better.  Then they thought, "Why don't we just put the nutrition into the ice cream itself?"  They made a few batches at home to see if it would make the patients eat.  Even with poor appetites and diminishing taste buds, their patients did not refuse the ice cream.   They got the calories they needed and a profile of essential vitamins & minerals they missed when they didn't drink their nutritional drink.

OUR PLAN

 When we saw that the ice cream was successful, we wanted to get it to others that need it. I started working on building a business plan that would enable more people suffering with poor appetite to have better lives.  I have had a lot of help to get Utter Nutrition’s plans in place.  We have had assistance with the Texas Tech Small Business Development Center in Abilene on our business plan.  We have received a grant from the Breckenridge Economic Development Board to fund our campaign and get established.  The people at the Texas Manufacturing Assistance Center have written us proposals for safety plans and leaning up our processes.  We also have a proposed patent on the facility from Visimid Technologies in Plano.  The manufacturing of this ice cream will go above and beyond the minimum standards for safety and quality with these proposals.  We believe we have a good plan in place and we have the resources to do it right.

As I tasked my way through the discovery mode of working on this startup, I was blown away by the response we perpetually received from the idea.  Medical professionals wanted the ice cream yesterday and were ready to purchase.  We have received several letters of intent to purchase from local nursing homes and assisted living communities.  We listened to so many personal accounts of people who wished that they had this product for their loved ones in the past.  It was made clear to us that our ice cream could make a significant impact on the well-being of others.  These often very personal and cathartic stories have strengthened our sense of purpose in bringing this concept to life.  It inspired us to make the Utter Nutrition concept, Better Foods for Better Lives.

THE CAMPAIGN

The funds raised in this campaign will cover our startup costs including building the facility, acquiring raw materials needed to manufacture the ice cream, and operating costs.  

Your contribution to our campaign will enable us to get this high quality ice cream to more people that need it.  Just think about your elderly family members whose taste buds are diminishing.  Think about children that are stubborn eaters. Think about athletes who burn hundreds of calories and need a power packed snack at the end of the day to curb their hunger.  Think about everyday hardworking people who often don’t have time to eat right.  Chances are you already know someone that is having trouble just getting the right amount of nutrition they need every day.  Ask yourself, who do you know?

Please go to http://www.utternutrition.com/who-do-you-know and tell us who you know that needs our ice cream on our blog. 

We want to hear from you whether you do or do not you donate.  

Interested in purchasing our ice cream after the campaign?  Please go to http://www.utternutrition.com/i-want-it-yesterday/ and register to be on the list of our first customers. 

PERKS:

If we reach our goal: 

$20 You get 7 servings of Utter Nutrition.  If you know someone who needs our product, this will let them try one a day for a week.  This will be a great package for those who want to sample our ice cream or want to share a few with friends or family.

$60 Get 21 servings of our delicious ice cream shipped to your door, fresh and ready to eat.  This is enough for those who need 2-4 servings a day for a week, or enough for one a day for three weeks.

$240 Replace the daily nutritional drink for a full month with delicious fortified ice cream!  Your family and loved ones will love having their freezer stocked with Utter Nutrition.  You get 84 servings shipped to your or your loved one's door.

good plan in place and we have the resources to do it right.As I tasked my way through the discovery mode of working on this startup, I was blown away by the response we perpetually received from the idea.  Medical professionals wanted the ice cream yesterday and were ready to purchase.  We have received several letters of intent to purchase from local nursing homes and assisted living communities.  We listened to so many personal accounts of people who wished that they had this product for their loved ones in the past.  It was made clear to us that our ice cream could make a significant impact on the well-being of others.  These often very personal and cathartic stories have strengthened our sense of purpose in bringing this concept to life.  It inspired us to make the Utter Nutrition concept, Better Foods for Better Lives.THE CAMPAIGNThe funds raised in this campaign will cover our startup costs including building the facility, acquiring raw materials needed to manufacture the ice cream, and operating costs.  Your contribution to our campaign will enable us to get this high quality ice cream to more people that need it.  Just think about your elderly family members whose taste buds are diminishing.  Think about children that are stubborn eaters. Think about athletes who burn hundreds of calories and need a power packed snack at the end of the day to curb their hunger.  Think about everyday hardworking people who often don’t have time to eat right.  Chances are you already know someone that is having trouble just getting the right amount of nutrition they need every day.  Ask yourself, who do you know?Please go to http://www.utternutrition.com/who-do-you-know and tell us who you know that needs our ice cream on our blog. We want to hear from you whether you do or do not you donate.  Interested in purchasing our ice cream after the campaign?  Please go to http://www.utternutrition.com/i-want-it-yesterday/ and register to be on the list of our first customers. PERKS:If we reach our goal: $20 You get 7 servings of Utter Nutrition.  If you know someone who needs our product, this will let them try one a day for a week.  This will be a great package for those who want to sample our ice cream or want to share a few with friends or family.$60 Get 21 servings of our delicious ice cream shipped to your door, fresh and ready to eat.  This is enough for those who need 2-4 servings a day for a week, or enough for one a day for three weeks.$240 Replace the daily nutritional drink for a full month with delicious fortified ice cream!  Your family and loved ones will love having their freezer stocked with Utter Nutrition.  You get 84 servings shipped to your or your loved one's door.

story:
The Charles E. Holman 

Morgellons Disease Foundation

501(c)3 Nonprofit

www.MorgellonsDisease.org

The CEHMDF is Serious About It.

Each year, the Charles E. Holman Morgellons Disease Foundation provides funding for medical-scientific research that will ultimately unlock the mysteries of Morgellons Disease.  The CEHMDF needs to raise $10,000 to fund the cost of vital and pivotal projects for the coming year. 

We are asking for tax-deductible contributions 
to make these opportunities realities.  

This is your chance to be part of a medical miracle that will help people today and generations yet to come. 


Who we are:   The Story of The Charles E. Holman          
                     Morgellons Disease Foundation           

In 2004, Charles and Cindy (Casey) Holman were determined to find answers about an unusual and debilitating condition, Morgellons Disease that had infected Cindy. The Charles E. Holman Morgellons Disease Foundation (aka The New Morgellons Order) was founded with commitment to honesty and integrity as an organization. The goals were then and remain today to fund scientific research, promote public awareness and to educate the medical community by providing objective research with scientific merit.  Officially receiving the status of 501(c) 3 nonprofit in January 2007, the organization's name was amended with the IRS to include Charles E. Holman to honor our founder for the work he had begun. Charles passed away in 2007 from heart related issues and did not have Morgellons. Cindy Casey-Holman, RN serves as the Director of The CEHMDF and continues to lead the fight for Morgellons patients everywhere. In 2014, we completed the process becoming officially The Charles E. Holman Morgellons Disease Foundation. This name more fully reflects and encompasses our mission and vision regarding our works toward effective treatment of patients and a cure to have a world without Morgellons disease.

Throughout the years, the strength and recognition of our organization have grown significantly. The CEHMDF is  recognized as the leading primary source for scientific information regarding Morgellons Disease.  We are listed on the Rare Disease Registry of the NIH. Attendance at our annual medical-scientific conference on Morgellons disease has multiplied exponentially.  We are humbled and honored by this demonstration of trust and confidence in the work we have done and continue to do.  We could not reach these goals without your support.

"Never doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed people can change the world. Indeed it is the only thing that ever has." 
  ~ Margaret Mead

What is Morgellons?

Morgellons Disease (MD) is a multi-system illness uniquely characterized by the formation of unusual fibers within the skin. MD is a debilitating, painful and life impacting condition consisting of slow-healing skin lesions, overwhelming fatigue, GI disturbances and an array of neurological deficits. Patients with Morgellons may shed unusual appearing particles from the skin described as fibers, sand or seed-like, black specks, or crystallized particles.

The distinguishing characteristic of Morgellons Disease (MD) is the presence of microscopic subcutaneous fibers sometimes referred to as filaments within the skin. Lighted microscopy (60-x minimum) enables the visualization of these unusual fibers, often-colored red, blue, black, white or clear, embedded in open skin lesions as well as their presence beneath intact skin.

What We're Doing:  Empowering Through Research.

Morgellons disease is a complex and misunderstood condition by most in the traditional mainstream medical communities.  Lack of knowledge and clinical research perpetuates untruths about the very real infectious etiology of this disease.  Patients are unnecessarily delayed in gaining access to an accurate diagnosis and effective treatment to relieve their suffering as well as disease progression. 

             Establishing Morgellons as an infectious disease 
    takes an over-abundance of reproducible scientific evidence.  
                   We have successfully begun the work.

We adhere strictly to science. Researchers from two esteemed universities, Oklahoma State University-Center for Health Sciences in Tulsa, OK and the University of New Haven in West Haven, CT as well as an international team of independent scientists volunteer their time to perform state-of-the-art scientific research.  Compilation of the works from these scientists is submitted for peer-review and, ultimately, accepted for journal publication.  Using research as key evidence in establishing Morgellons as a true physiological disease is the fundamental approach for recognition and acceptance of this condition.

Since the emergence of Morgellons in about 2002, the questions of ‘Where to go for help?’ and ‘What do people do?’ have echoed throughout the world.  Each day the volunteers of The CEHMDF respond to cries from people across the US and worldwide dealing with symptoms of this disease.  Many have lost everything since becoming sick ... their jobs and financial security to provide for themselves, their homes, friends and family.   Some people have had CPS take their children (assigning a Munchausen's by proxy label to them).  Some even resort to taking their own lives, having lost all hope and nowhere to turn.  Most doctors are perplexed as well and do not know how to help.

 In 2011, scientists searching for an infectious cause in Morgellons disease finally found promising leads.  In 2012-2103, research began to scratch the surface of the mystery, revealing that pathogenic bacteria were indeed involved.   In 2014 to the present, CEHMDF Funded Research has shown:

---  The Morgellons fibers/filaments are composed of human keratin and collagen    produced by keratinocytes/fibroblasts in the skin in response to an infection;

---  4 bacterial species have been identified in Morgellons samples;

---  Borrelia spirochetes have been identified abundantly in every Morgellons    sample.

---  Most patients receiving evaluation and treatment for Borrelia by knowledgeable medical providers have improvement of the Morgellons symptoms;

---Morgellons disease is not an imagined or delusional mental condition.  Borrelia affects the central and peripheral nervous systemcould cause behavior changes and psychiatric manifestations esp. if left untreated.  Some Morgellons patients experience behavioral changes possibly due to untreated Borrelia.

               Our Record Speaks and Shows Our Commitment

   


                                                           


The Impact

Through the years, we have seen the sustaining power of humanity in the stories of the many who suffer with Morgellons.  This research is critical in establishing Morgellons as a true infectious disease.  The evidence will give credence to the voices of those who have endured the worst that medicine currently has to offer.The failure to acknowledge and the compliancy towards the serious underlying cause of Morgellons symptoms have horrible consequences as we have seen.  Our goal is to provide credible and replicable scientific research on Morgellons disease to place this condition firmly on the medical map.  Ultimately, this will enable all patients who suffer with this disease to have access to appropriate medical care and will pave the road for more effective treatment.

The CEHMDF continues to advance the research and recognition of Morgellons.  Throughout this past year, with your support, we have funded research for numerous scientists. A comprehensive paper authored by a team of international researchers was published in BMC Dermatology.  Further research by this team continues and we expect additional publications soon.  Research at University of New Haven under direction of Eva Sapi, PhD continues and we hope this brings yet another scientific publication on the topic of Morgellons to the peer reviewed medical literature.  Morgellons research at Oklahoma State University, under the direction of Randy Wymore, PhD continues and we expect a publication of their findings will soon be available.  All of these efforts take an incredible amount of time and money.  Your support makes it possible.

Additional academic researchers who wish to explore a variety of aspects of Morgellons disease have recently approached the CEHMDF.  At the recent ILADS conference in October, scientists from the U.S. and Europe expressed a sincere interest in helping to investigate this disease. We would love to participate in these offers but currently do not have the funding to do so.

We need to expand our educational outreach in order to bring in more clinicians who will better understand Morgellons and provide optimal treatment to patients.  We are accomplishing this objective by setting up booths at medical conferences, holding our own annual medical-scientific conference and by providing interested physicians with educational materials and DVDs from our annual conference.  In addition to our need for research funding, we currently need funding to support videotaping of our conference and for the printed materials that we provide to educate health care providers.  


What We Need From You...

The CEHMDF is a 501 © nonprofit, all volunteer organization.   CEHMDF does not pay salaries or  receive any grants and relies solely upon the donations you provide to fund research projects, medical providers’ educational programs and patient support-outreach programs.  In order to continue this very important work we are counting on your help.  Please help us continue this very costly research. We are so close. Thousands of  people throughout the world are waiting.  Our scientists and researchers need your support.

As 2015 comes to an end, we ask that you will please consider a tax-deductible gift to the CEHMDF.  We commit to you to use your gifts wisely to further research efforts and to educate the world about the reality of Morgellons disease.  

The Charles E. Holman Morgellons Disease Foundation Vision Statement:

“We seek discovery of the cause and a cure for Morgellons Disease.”

Thank you for your support.


Cindy Casey-Holman, RN

Director

Board of Directors

Medical Advisory Board

Scientific Advisory Board

Nursing Advisory Board

Volunteer Members of The CEHMDF

The Charles E. Holman Morgellons Disease Foundation

www.MorgellonsDisease.org

story:
Tula Yoga Studio opened it's doors in October of 2011. Since it's opening, we have received a very warm welcoming and overwhelmingly positive response from the community. We are ever so grateful for this. 

Tula would love to be able to offer MORE to this amazing community. We need funds to be able to build-out a second space which will be located in the basement of the current studio. This expanded space and second yoga studio will allow us to offer more classes at different time slots, explore different styles of yoga + meditation, more kids and baby programming and offer more in-depth workshops. We can also use the space to offer students Thai Bodywork, private yoga sessions and develop a Teacher Training program. Finally, this extra space can be utilized as a community meeting place to hold broader (non-yoga) neighborhood events. 

If we receive enough funds, the new space is expected to open in June of 2016. 

What We Need & What You Get

We raised $5000 in our first round of funding, now we are looking to raise another $20,000 to cover approximately half of the expansion build-out costs (total of $25,000). 

In exchange for your contribution, we are offering yoga (of course!), private yoga sessions, Thai Bodywork sessions, a spot in our upcoming 2017 retreat in Bali! (with Natalie McGreal and Rhiannon Kirby) and some unique Tula swag (tanks and sweatshirts)!  

Risks & Challenges

As with any construction project, timelines can change, scope can change and roadblocks can be hit. Fortunately, we have done this before with the first build-out. We have experience dealing with contractors and we have the full support of the neighborhood and other businesses owners to help with the process as well. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to financially support us at this time, you can still help!

Help us spread the word! Pass this IndieGogo link to your circle of friends. Post this link on Social Media!

story:
I Have Transformed My Body, So Can You.

Side by side comparison: before (left) and after (right)


Based on the experience and the knowledge I gained through my transformation, I have created a no-nonsense, result-oriented, simple, easy-to-follow fitness and nutrition program for everyone. 

Yes, EVERYONE.

I want everyone to achieve the level of physical fitness they want, and not just for what you will see in the mirror. Having more energy and feeling more confident in everything you do will change your life. Oh how I wish somebody would have sat me down years ago and told me what I have prepared to share with you. 

Why Should You Pledge to This Campaign?

Two Reasons:

  1. Because I can help you transform your body as I did mine. By pledging to help me finish the production of this program and spread the word for me, we can help more people reach their health and fitness goals.
  2. Our fitness and health are two of the most important things to our success, and I have struggled with both for most of my life. However, I had a breakthrough about a year ago, and I have spent the past 12 months working on putting together this program that can help anyone obtain both, and I want everyone to have it. Don't get me wrong, this is not an overnight thing, it requires hard work, but the result is guaranteed and you will be able to achieve it with extreme efficiency. 
Pledge now to support this campaign and transform your body!

How Am I So Confident About this?

Because I personally tested it and transformed myself. 

This was me: 

This is me now:

Here Is My Story

I had a rough start. I have always wanted to be an elite athlete - play basketball, run track, etc. But I had a heart problem that prohibited me from gaining any sort of muscle. For years I struggled, thinking that I might never be able to achieve my dreams. I worked hard, tried all sorts of fitness programs (there is so much false information out there that is non-sense), I ate tons, tried different supplements...no results.

I thought I was doomed because of genetics and my health problems, but when you really want something, you don't give up. A thought occurred to me one day, my challenge was merely an obstacle.


I began noticing patterns, specific things all people who are successful in making/keeping their body in top condition do. I started studying the hard science behind their methods. As I wrote down all my findings, I saw the simplicity in them. However, I was skeptical. So, I started experimenting with these methods in my own life. To my disbelief, I saw some results in a matter of days, and noticeable results in weeks. This program I've developed isn't an overnight transformation system. It will require consistent, hard work over time. 

The photo you saw above shows the difference of 45 pounds of muscle that I gained in a little over 9 months of following these patterns I found.

Pledge now to support this campaign and transform your body!

Course Map



How Is This Program Any Different From Other Fitness Programs?

The X Factor section of this course provides what is often the missing link for people when it comes to fitness and getting outstanding results. If you've tried working out before without getting the results you want, this section will make you instantly realize why. Or, if you're new to working out, you will see how you can get to where you want to be.

I wasn't kidding when I said I have tried all sorts of programs. They just didn't work. I would make excuses like, "I have a health problem" or "I have worked hard, but I just can't seem to overcome my genetics". For me, I realized these thoughts are self-fulfilling prophesies, mental blocks. They are believable, because when you couple these often false beliefs with fitness programs that contain tons of non-sense, you simply don't get results.

I believe that many so-called personal trainers or fitness gurus tell you a lot of excessive, un-useful information in order to make more money, and charge you for more time. It is sick how much time and money people waste working with these people. 

In this course, you will only find exactly what you need to know in order to get real results.

Pledge now to support this campaign and transform your body!

Here are some samples of my program:

X Factor

Pledge now to support this campaign and transform your body!

Nutrition


Pledge now to support this campaign and transform your body!

Gym Sessions


Pledge now to support this campaign and transform your body!

Music Credit:

Drive by Alex (c) 2013 Licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution (3.0) license. http://ccmixter.org/files/AlexBeroza/43098 Ft: cdk & Darryl J

Gravity by Alex (c) 2013 Licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution Noncommercial (3.0) license. http://ccmixter.org/files/AlexBeroza/44073 Ft: Daniel Hardy Wallace


Risks & Challenges

There really aren't any challenges and risks at this point in the project. 
I have completed all of the filming, and I am finishing up the editing. What I need help with most is awareness, I need help spreading the word about my campaign and my journey of transformation, so I can help more people do the same.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your(this, my) campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

Because I can help you transform your body as I did mine. By pledging to help me finish the production of this program and spread the word for me, we can help more people reach their health and fitness goals.


Our fitness and health are two of the most important things to our success, and I have struggled with both for most of my life. However, I had a breakthrough about a year ago, and I have spent the past 12 months working on putting together this program that can help anyone obtain both, and I want everyone to have it. Don't get me wrong, this is not an overnight thing, it requires hard work, but the result is guaranteed and you will be able to achieve it with extreme efficiency. 

Pledge now to support this campaign and transform your body!

How Am I So Confident About this?
Because I personally tested it and transformed myself. 
This was me: 

This is me now:


Here Is My Story

I had a rough start. I have always wanted to be an elite athlete - play basketball, run track, etc. But I had a heart problem that prohibited me from gaining any sort of muscle. For years I struggled, thinking that I might never be able to achieve my dreams. I worked hard, tried all sorts of fitness programs (there is so much false information out there that is non-sense), I ate tons, tried different supplements...no results.
I thought I was doomed because of genetics and my health problems, but when you really want something, you don't give up. A thought occurred to me one day, my challenge was merely an obstacle.


I began noticing patterns, specific things all people who are successful in making/keeping their body in top condition do. I started studying the hard science behind their methods. As I wrote down all my findings, I saw the simplicity in them. However, I was skeptical. So, I started experimenting with these methods in my own life. To my disbelief, I saw some results in a matter of days, and noticeable results in weeks. This program I've developed isn't an overnight transformation system. It will require consistent, hard work over time. 
The photo you saw above shows the difference of 45 pounds of muscle that I gained in a little over 9 months of following these patterns I found.
Pledge now to support this campaign and transform your body!
Course Map




How Is This Program Any Different From Other Fitness Programs?
The X Factor section of this course provides what is often the missing link for people when it comes to fitness and getting outstanding results. If you've tried working out before without getting the results you want, this section will make you instantly realize why. Or, if you're new to working out, you will see how you can get to where you want to be.
I wasn't kidding when I said I have tried all sorts of programs. They just didn't work. I would make excuses like, "I have a health problem" or "I have worked hard, but I just can't seem to overcome my genetics". For me, I realized these thoughts are self-fulfilling prophesies, mental blocks. They are believable, because when you couple these often false beliefs with fitness programs that contain tons of non-sense, you simply don't get results.
I believe that many so-called personal trainers or fitness gurus tell you a lot of excessive, un-useful information in order to make more money, and charge you for more time. It is sick how much time and money people waste working with these people. 
In this course, you will only find exactly what you need to know in order to get real results.

story:
Prana is designed to restore healthy breathing and posture habits to greatly reduce the daily stress we carry around.



Quick video demos


   Passive Tracking     


   Active Training     

               

 

Stress and Breathing Connection

75% to 90% of all doctor’s office visits are due to stress related ailments and complaints, with OSHA estimating stress costing American industry alone more than $300 billion a year.

Why is breathing so important? Beyond keeping us alive, how we breathe can have a huge impact on our stress levels and physiology. Breathing is one of the few body functions we have both conscious and unconscious control over. Specific ways of breathing have been proven to calm the nervous system and lower stress. And posture can directly affect the quality of our breathing, as well as impact back pain. Prolonged office sitting in front of a computer can take a serious toll on the quality of your breathing and posture, fueling stress.

Prana makes it easy to harness the power of good breathing and posture for many healthy benefits. Prana can trigger a relaxation response within two minutes of use. It is a 100% drug free stress relief device.


How does Prana work?

Prana is the first activity tracker to combine three critical body function measures to comprehensively improve the quality of breathing for maximum stress fighting results. These measures are diaphragmatic breathing, posture, and breath patterns. Prana's advanced algorithms uniquely integrate these measures in a clear actionable way. Our app provides both passive tracking and active training strategies to improve how we breathe. Passive tracking monitors your breathing and posture in the background, occasionally warning you to adjust your breath or body pose. Our active training provides a fully interactive gamified experience to make it easy and fun to retrain breathing for many lasting benefits. 


Prana lowers stress by rapidly triggering your body’s relaxation response (also known as the parasympathetic response). The parasympathetic response is the opposite of fight or flight mode which many of us get chronically locked into. Having your bloodstream constantly flooded with stress hormones and adrenaline can contribute and worsen many serious health issues including:   

  • Heart disease
  • Hypertension
  • Digestive disorders
  • Panic attacks
  • Lowered immune function and infection
  • Erectile dysfunction
  • Insomnia
  • Depression
  • Headaches
  • Diabetes
  • Asthma and COPD (this additional application of Prana is discussed below)
  • Systemic inflammation

Nearly every system of your body is susceptible to the ravages of stress. Proper breathing is a natural non-drug way to rapidly tap into your body’s built-in stress reduction mechanism (see this Harvard article on how good breathing lowers stress). Prana is designed to make such stress-busting breathing accessible to everyone. 


As Featured on:



What People are Saying:

GIZMAG  – "Prana focuses on breathing and posture to promote relaxation."

BUSINESS INSIDER – “This brilliant little gadget could stop your office job from killing you.”

BRIT + CO. – “Seated posture and breathing have a lot to do with your productivity. The folks at Prana know that more than most.”

VentureBeat – “Forget steps and calories — Prana’s wearable tracks breath and posture.”

TechCrunch – “Prana aims to change how you behave.”

Yahoo News – “Prana is inspired by the idea that good habits in the two domains [of breathing and posture] can lead to stress reduction, improved concentration and even reduced back pain.”



Prana Wearable and App

Prana includes:

  • An elegantly designed clip-on device worn on the waistband, featuring a stylish metallically finished case, measuring only 1.25” X ¼” for a comfortable and non-obtrusive wearable experience (black version available with stretch goal 1), Bluetooth LE connection to your smartphone
  • Wireless charging base
  • A mobile app with cutting edge patent pending algorithms seamlessly unifying diaphragmatic breathing, posture, and breath patterns
  • For both iOS & Android


Passive Tracking


While you're sitting, Prana normally functions in the background. It only alerts you if it detects signs of stressful breathing or poor posture. When we are stressed, we tend to breathe faster and more shallow, with breathing often shifting to the chest from the belly, which Prana can detect. Poor posture in turn can limit air flow into the lungs, further disrupting our breathing pattern, and contribute to back pain. Prana can notify either by a gentle on-device buzz, or through a smartphone alert, that it’s time to improve breathing or posture or both.

      



Prana Optimizes Breathing

Prana is designed not only to lower stress, but to optimize our breathing for the full spectrum of long term health benefits. It is the only wearable that looks at respiration not as an isolated signal, but holistically in connection with two critical biomechanical functions which affect the quality of breathing: Diaphragmatic breathing and posture. Diaphragmatic breathing together with the proper breath pattern have been shown to more effectively activate our relaxation response than simply trying to slow respiration rate. And posture can directly impact the quality of our breath patterns. This is why we have integrated these three measures to give a complete picture of our breathing, and for maximizing stress reduction. Our system is fully transparent so that you can see in real-time that breath tracking is accurate and actually working.


Diaphragmatic Breathing



Prana is the first wearable specifically designed to monitor and train diaphragmatic (belly) breathing, the most natural and healthy way to breathe, which has been disrupted by modern stresses. For most today, the source of breathing has shifted upwards, with chest or accessory muscles being used to inflate the lungs. This shallow, stressed, and unnatural form of breathing neglects the lower lobes of our lungs, which have up to 7 times the oxygen carrying capacity. The benefits of diaphragmatic breathing have been emphasized by ancient traditions for thousands of years, and supported by many recent medical studies. Prana helps to restore this healthy natural form of breathing--utilizing more of our lung capacity--by providing a sensor which detects and helps guide the movement of our diaphragm, and an app which both warns and proactively trains us to breathe in this manner.


Posture

A strong connection between posture and breath has been emphasized by many traditions for thousands of years, including Yoga Pranayama. The basic idea is that good posture facilitates good breathing. This idea is now supported by a number of recent studies and research. For example, this research paper found a significant relationship between a particular seated posture and the quality of pulmonary function. These researchers found that in slumped sitting, spirometric measurements of forced vital capacity, forced expiratory volume, and peak expiratory flow were all significantly decreased compared to a normal upright seated posture. Our posture affects the distribution of weight of visceral organs on our diaphragm, which affects its mobility when breathing. Prana's advanced algorithms are able to disentangle breathing from posture to provide a posture-corrected breathing signal, all from one location on the body. Prana warns us when our posture can be improved, and our app understand how different postures impact breathing.

There are many additional benefits of good posture which Prana helps support, including preventing back problems and muscular pain, less fatigue (since muscles are used more efficiently), decreased stress on joints, ligaments and the spine, as well as improving our appearance.


Breath Patterns 

COPD

Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) is the 3rd leading cause of death in the United States. Beyond reducing stress, we single out COPD as an application where Prana can offer significant assistance. It is well known that a high percentage of sufferers of COPD have compromised diaphragm function. By specifically training diaphragmatic breathing, Prana can help COPD patients strengthen their diaphragm to breathe in a more effective way, potentially offering significant relief.

Below is a video of a COPD patient trying Prana for the first time (this is with an earlier belt-version of Prana, though our pod version functions in the same way). Within seconds, he was able to shift his breathing to his diaphragm, and receive immediate visual real-time feedback that he was doing it in the correct way. Here is an excerpt of his comments:

“This would really be great to teach me how to breathe from my abdomen. I’m a really shallow breather... I feel it would be a great tool to help people learn how to breath properly.”



Our Perks

Prana Sensors and Hardware

  • Prana utilizes highly sensitive multi-axis accelerometers, making even the lightest breathing detectable
  • Low energy Bluetooth (BLE) connection to most smartphones  (iOS and Android)
  • Energy efficient mobile processor with flash memory
  • Switchless design
  • Rechargeable Battery life of 7 days and up
  • Qi wireless charging base
  • Vibrational element to gently inform via on-device buzz when breath or posture can be improved
  • Highly advanced new algorithms to disentangle breath from posture signals from one location on the waistband
  • Sleek and metallically finished case with clip, worn on the waist (1.25″ x 0.25″)


Stretch Goal #1 $100K

If we are able to hit $100k, we can offer an alternate color version of the Prana wearable, in black. Some of you have requested this color for better coordination with certain outfits. We'd love to be able to provide this option for our initial delivery. 

Stretch Goal #2 $200K

Our app will be going live with the Zen garden theme for the game component. If we are able to hit a $200k goal, we’d love to add some flare and variety by including an Atlantis themed underwater game world, where your controlled breathing and posture maneuvers you around ancient ruins and perky sea creatures.


Timeline and History of Development

We started our mission way back in November of 2012, first conducting extensive research to learn as much as possible about the science of breathing, how it impacts our stress and health, and then designing a suite of new patent pending algorithms to address the unique challenges of tracking diaphragmatic breath, posture, and activity all from a single point on the waistband. We have built countless prototypes along the way, starting with a belt approach, and slowly improving and evolving our capabilities to shift to our single pod which can track all these features from one location.

September 2014—clip-on hardware prototypes fully functional 

May 2015 —major upgrades to Prana algorithms and software 

August 2015—Extensive user testing completed

December 2015— publication of our 204 page patent application

January 2016—Launch of Indiegogo Campaign

June 2016—Target delivery date of Prana to our Indiegogo backers


Who we are:

Based in San Francisco, we bring together a multidisciplinary team, spanning medical science, software/hardware engineering, game design, and app development experience. We were drawn together to build Prana out of our shared passion for health, meditation, and Yoga, with decades of practice dedicated to these areas between our founding team. Our founders:


Andre Persidsky: CEO, Co-Founder

Andre is an engineer, patented inventor, computer book author, and entrepreneur, with dozens of inventions from consumer electronics to medical devices.



Alex Ahlund: VP Interactive & Design, Co-Founder

Alex is a video game industry vet who has worn virtually every hat in the business, from game designer to executive producer, with extensive experience building engaging mobile apps.


Thank you for your support!

Please follow us on our Website, Twitter, or Facebook pages.



FAQ

Why does it matter how we breathe?
Beyond keeping us alive, how we breathe affects many aspects of our health. In particular, proper breathing is a gateway for rapidly triggering the relaxation response (parasympathetic response) which helps to put the body and mind into a deeply calmed state. Many of us are spending far too much time with our sympathetic nervous systems cranked up (fight or flight mode), which can worsen many serious health conditions.

Aren't respiration rate trackers already available?
Very few in the broader wearables space, and Prana goes much deeper than simply providing a respiration rate. It uniquely integrates three critical measures for assessing the true quality of our breathing: diaphragmatic breathing, posture, and breath patterns. By providing this complete picture of breathing, along with a gamified app training program, we believe we are offering something truly new and needed in the wearables space today.

Can't I just do breathing exercises?
Sure, but most people find it quite difficult and boring to commit to doing so for any extended period of time. Prana offers an engaging new way to learn healthy breathing habits while charting your progress over time. Prana also functions as a coach, giving you immediate visual feedback so that you know you are breathing in a proper way, along with maintaining good posture.

Does Prana track breathing and posture while walking?
When you sit, Prana tracks breathing and posture. And when you stand and walk around, it switches to activity/step tracking. The reason and strategy behind this is that the quality of our breathing/posture are much more susceptible to being compromised when we sit for prolonged periods of time compared to standing, and this is the main problem that Prana is striving to address (average office worker sits nearly 6 hours a day). When we are active and walking, we are already doing something good for our health, so we felt this was not the optimum time to be alerting the user. Additionally, when active, respiration rate naturally increases, so using that as one of the indicators of stress is not as valid as when sitting.

How can Prana measure posture from the waistband near the belly?

Prana started off as a belt, monitoring the posture component with a separate sensor positioned near the lower back. But turns out you can also measure posture from the belly and lower abdominal area. You can try it for yourself. Slouch and then sit upright and notice how the angles in that area change significantly. The challenge is that this signal is confounded with diaphragmatic breathing signals, and that's a big part of what we've been working on to disentagle.

How is Prana's battery charged?

Prana uses a lithium ion rechargeable battery, requiring charging about every 7 days. We started with a wired charging station, but eventually found an effective design for integrating a QI wireless charging system, so our wearable is completely wireless for maximum convenience.

An elegantly designed clip-on device worn on the waistband, featuring a stylish metallically finished case, measuring only 1.25” X ¼” for a comfortable and non-obtrusive wearable experience (black version available with stretch goal 1), Bluetooth LE connection to your smartphone
Wireless charging base

For both iOS & Android





Passive Tracking

When we are stressed, we tend to breathe faster and more shallow, with breathing often shifting to the chest from the belly, which Prana can detect. Poor posture in turn can limit air flow into the lungs, further disrupting our breathing pattern, and contribute to back pain. Prana can notify either by a gentle on-device buzz, or through a smartphone alert, that it’s time to improve breathing or posture or both.
      


 Active Training (Gamified)


Our active training mode allows you to participate in short game sessions (2 to 3 minutes) to consciously train the quality of your breathing. This is where you can rapidly experience a relaxation response.
You start a game session whenever you feel like it. You can use it as a therapeutic tool to reduce stress, anxiety, and even stop a panic attack. And you can use it to retrain and learn better breathing habits. Our app can be set to alert you to start a training session (a tune-up) whenever passive tracking results are less than optimal (i.e. poor breathing or posture have been detected for an extended period of time).
As in the video below, the game works by tracking your real-time breathing as you fly through a colorful Zen garden. The goal is to collect flowers by carefully controlling inhalations and exhalations to follow the target breath pattern, while maintaining good posture. You directly control the game character with your breathing, with the bird flying higher as you inhale, and lower as you exhale (by means of a live Bluetooth connection between Prana and your smartphone). Staying within the flower pattern means you are breathing in the right way for the selected pattern. Good posture activates the forward scrolling motion. With our anti-stress pattern, you can feel calmer in as little as two minutes.      Sitting and Standing
Prana recognizes when you sit or stand. While you sit, Prana analyzes your breath patterns, diaphragmatic breathing, and posture. When you stand or walk, Prana automatically switches to standing mode where it functions as a step tracker. We employ this strategy because the quality of breathing is most vulnerable to disruption while sitting and being inactive, especially during stressful times.



Prana Optimizes Breathing


Prana is designed not only to lower stress, but to optimize
our breathing for the full spectrum of long term health benefits. It is the
only wearable that looks at respiration not as an isolated signal, but
holistically in connection with two critical biomechanical functions which
affect the quality of breathing: Diaphragmatic breathing and posture.
Diaphragmatic breathing together with the proper breath pattern have been shown
to more effectively activate our relaxation response than simply trying to slow respiration rate. And posture can directly impact the quality of our breath
patterns. This is why we have integrated these three measures to give a
complete picture of our breathing, and for maximizing stress reduction. Our system is fully transparent so that you can see in real-time that breath tracking is accurate and actually working.


Diaphragmatic Breathing




Prana is the first
wearable specifically designed to monitor and train diaphragmatic (belly)
breathing, the most natural and healthy way to breathe, which has been
disrupted by modern stresses. For most today, the source of breathing has
shifted upwards, with chest or accessory muscles being used to inflate the
lungs. This shallow, stressed, and unnatural form of breathing neglects the
lower lobes of our lungs, which have up to 7 times the oxygen carrying
capacity. The benefits of diaphragmatic breathing have been emphasized by
ancient traditions for thousands of years, and supported by many recent medical
studies. Prana helps to restore this healthy natural form of breathing--utilizing more of our lung capacity--by providing
a sensor which detects and helps guide the movement of our diaphragm, and an app which both
warns and proactively trains us to breathe in this manner.

Posture
A strong connection between posture and breath has been emphasized by many traditions for thousands of years, including Yoga Pranayama. The basic idea is that good posture facilitates good breathing. This idea is now supported by a number of recent studies and research. For example, this research paper found a significant relationship between a particular seated posture and the quality of pulmonary function. These researchers found that in slumped sitting, spirometric measurements of forced vital capacity, forced expiratory volume, and peak expiratory flow were all significantly decreased compared to a normal upright seated posture. Our posture affects the distribution of weight of visceral organs on our diaphragm, which affects its mobility when breathing. Prana's advanced algorithms are able to disentangle breathing from posture to provide a posture-corrected breathing signal, all from one location on the body. Prana warns us when our posture can be improved, and our app understand how different postures impact breathing.
There are many additional benefits of good posture which Prana helps support, including preventing back problems and muscular pain, less fatigue (since muscles are used more efficiently), decreased stress on joints, ligaments and the spine, as well as improving our appearance.


Breath Patterns 



A breath pattern goes far beyond what can be captured by a
simple summary statistic such as respiration rate. It is defined by how we
breathe over time, with parameters such as inhalation time, depth, retention,
smoothness, exhalation time, and time between breaths. Recent studies have
found that the patterns we employ, both consciously and unconsciously, can have a major impact. For example, research has found that prolonging
exhalation times versus inhalation can help to more rapidly trigger the
relaxation response and a feeling of calmness (by means of more efficiently
stimulating the Vagus nerve, also known at the Pneumogastric nerve). Prana provides and trains these types of relaxation response patterns, including a pattern called called 4-7-8 (inhale for 4
seconds, hold breath for 7 seconds, exhale for 8 seconds) which has been shown as highly effective in curbing anxiety attacks in as little as just a few minutes (a
great possible alternative to Xanax and other addicting benzodiazepine drugs).
Other patterns have been found to increase energy (controlled rapid breathing
for a short duration), while others are very good for enhancing concentration
(such as a popular pattern from Yoga Pranayama called Sama Vritti, emphasizing
equal controlled inhalation and exhalation times).

Visualized Breath Patterns and Stats
Prana has been designed to make it clear and easy to unlock the benefits of following specific breathing patterns. Our app offers two primary ways to visualize your real-time breath pattern: our game mode (previously discussed), and our clinical mode. Our game mode again shows the contours of the target breath pattern against a carefully timed scrolling background, with your breathing directly controlling the movement of the game character through the pattern. Our Clinical Mode provides a more in-depth timeline interface for tracking 10 distinct breath stats, posture, and displaying real-time breath patterns, as well as scoring each breath with respect to a target breath pattern. 



Here are the real-time stats we track:




Respiration rate


Inhalation time


Exhalation time (both absolute and relative)


Breath retention


Time between breaths


Breath uniformity (smoothness)


Diaphragm excursion


Posture


Adjusted inhalation depth relative to posture


Frequency of full breaths


Tidal volume



Benefits beyond Stress Reduction
Our app offers a library of dozens of distinct breath patterns/exercises for active training. Popular patterns include "Wake Up", "Focus", and "Wind Down", which translate to different breathing exercises from traditions around the world, such as Yoga Pranayama, Buteyko, Tai Chi, 4-7-8, and many others. While stress reduction is our primary application--and we offer precise breath patterns to achieve that--our library of breathing patterns supports other applications, including:

Lowering blood pressure and heart rate 
Increasing energy
Improving focus
Helping to fall sleep
Strengthening the immune system
Helping with chronic pain
Improving mood
Improving heart rate variability (HRV) 
Even patterns for helping medical conditions such as Asthma, COPD, migraines, and irritable bowel syndrome.  




COPD
Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) is
the 3rd leading cause of death in the United States. Beyond reducing stress, we single out COPD as an
application where Prana can offer significant assistance. It is well known that a high percentage of
sufferers of COPD have compromised diaphragm function. By specifically training diaphragmatic
breathing, Prana can help COPD patients strengthen their diaphragm to breathe
in a more effective way, potentially offering significant relief.

first time (this is with an earlier belt-version of Prana, though our pod version functions in the same way). Within seconds, he

my abdomen. I’m a really shallow breather... I feel it would be a great tool to
help people learn how to breath properly.”
