story:
35 Days and 3500 Miles 

My name is Doug Michael and my best friend Trey Gray has Huntington's Disease (HD). 

(Pictured Left to Right) Trey and Doug 2003

While I have supported HD for over a decade now I want to do something big to bring awareness to the cause and raise money for research. So, I have decided to ride a bike across the United States. Your help can bring about more awareness of this disease while also helping raise the funds needed to find a cure. If everyone who knows someone with HD were to contribute just $2 to this cause think about the impact and the difference this would make. Help me get the word out and let's make a difference!

What is Huntington's Disease

Huntington's disease (HD) is a neurodegenerative genetic disorder that affects muscle coordination and leads to mental decline and behavioral symptoms. There is no cure for Huntington's Disease. Huntington's Disease usually begins between 35 and 44 years of age and with a life expectancy of 10 to 25 years in adults and cases starting before the age of 21 years life expectancy is only 10 years. Some people have described it as having MS, Parkinson and Dementia all in one.

The Journey 

I will be riding a bicycle for about 3500 from California to New York. I'll be starting at the Rose Bowl in Pasadena, CA, then traveling to Nashville, TN and then from there I will be heading north to South Bend, IN. After I leave South Bend I will be heading east to the Big Apple, New York City, where my ride will end at Yankee Stadium. During my ride I will be stopping in communities to do interviews on radio, television, newspaper and any other types of media outlets telling people about what I am doing and why we need their support for HD. I will be taking pictures and posting updates on the website that we will be setting up so you can follow the Journey daily. I won't be alone, coming with me in the support vehicle and sometimes riding himself will be Trey Gray. Some of you may know Trey from his work with Huntington's Disease Society of America as their former spokesperson,   the HD documentary film Alive and Well that he was in or for being a professional musician the last 20 years playing and touring with Faith Hill, Jewel, Brooks n Dunn and Ronnie Dunn. 

Trey Gray 2011

We are raising $55,000. The money we raise will be going to "The Trey Gray Fund for Huntington's Disease" at the Vanderbilt University research center for HD and for covering the expenses of traveling 3500 miles. The expenses include renting a support vehicle (a small RV) to carry the support team, extra equipment that is needed such as spare tires and an extra bike, hotels, gas, a website so the public can follow our progress and a PR person to help us get to interviews on the different media outlets while we are on the journey. It will take us between 35 to 50 days depending on weather, rode conditions and the number of interviews that take place.

What You Get When You Help 

First we want you all to know that all donation go directly to finding a cure and raising awereness. Second, we've kept our perks pretty conservative as we want the funds we raise to go to the cause and not the expenses of paying for merchandise but Country Recording Artists Rodney Atkins has donated Meet and Greet Passes for one of our perks. Big Thanks to Rodney Atkins!

Who would like to receive 2 free HD t-shirts and a Meet and Greet pass good for 2 to Rodney Atkins? We are starting a Referral Contest. Simply login to your indiegogo account or create one (it's free), Go to our campaign page and then share (Facebook, Twitter or email) and encourage people to donate. At the end of the campaign the top two people that have brought in the most donations from their referrals will each receive 2 free t-shirts and the person who raised the most will also get the "Meet and Greet" passes. The more times you share the campaign the better chance you have of winning. Good luck and God Bless!!!

  • $2 See your name with a Special Thanks on the website              
  • $10 See your name and photo with a Special Thanks on the website
  • $40 See your name and photo with a Special Thanks on the website and an awesome T-shirt saying you supported the cause
  • $60 (3 Available) See your name and photo with a Special Thanks on the website and 2 (Two) awesome T-shirt saying you supported the cause and a pair of concert played drum sticks autographed by Trey Gray. 
  • $60 See your name and photo with a Special Thanks on the website and 2 (Two) awesome T-shirt saying you supported the cause


  • $100 (500) See your name and photo with a Special Thanks on the website and a personally autographed drum head to you from Trey Gray (Credits: Faith Hill, Jewel, Brooks n Dunn, Ronnie Dunn)
  • $250 (100) See your name and photo with a Special Thanks on the website as a V.I.P. supporter. In addition you will receive one of those awesome T-shirts a numbered limited addition personally autographed drum head and a pair of drum sticks that Trey has played with in concert. Only 100 of these to give away.
  • $300 (5) See your name and photo on the website as a Heavenly supporter. In addition you will receive one of those awesome T-shirts and Trey Gray and Doug Michael will come to your home and help you make Potato Salad. If you are on the route to NYC we'll stop by and if your not we'll come right after the ride in July. You supply the ingredients and we'll supply the love.
  • $300 (5) See your name and photo on the website as a Rock Star supporter. In addition you will receive one of those awesome T-shirts and one Meet and Greet Pass, good for two people, to meet with Country Recording Artist Rodney Atkins at  a show of your choice during his 2015 tour where he is doing Meet and Greets (Most shows will have a Meet and Greet). (Academy of Country Music winner  -  Male Vocalist of the Year in 2006). Limited to only 5. Concert tickets are not included with the Meet and Greet Passes.
  • $500 See your name and photo on the website as a Bronze Sponsor supporter. In addition you will receive one of those awesome T-shirts also saying that you are a Sponsor. By being a Bronze Sponsor you've taken that extra step to really help.
  • $1000 (50) See your name and photo on the website as a Silver Sponsor supporter. In addition you will receive one of those awesome T-shirts also saying you are a Sponsor and your name or your business name on the side of the support vehicle as a Silver Sponsor. You are letting everyone know at this level you are not going to let HD win.
  • $2500 (25) See your name and photo on the website as a Gold Sponsor supporter. In addition you will receive one of those awesome Sponsor T-shirts and your name or your business name on the side of the support vehicle as a Gold Sponsor plus your name or your business name on my biking jersey. I will be wearing a biking jersey during the ride and during all interviews. Everyone knows at this level you are in it to win it and that HD will be on the losing end of this battle.
  • $6500 (3) See your name and photo on the website as a Platinum Sponsor supporter. In addition you will receive one of those awesome T-shirts, your name or your business name on the side of the support vehicle as a Platinum Sponsor, your name or your business name on my biking jersey, you will receive one of the three touring bikes that will be used on the ride and one of the official biking jerseys I will be wearing during the 3500 mile trip that will also be signed by Trey and myself. You're a true champion for helping.
Let's all join together to make this a success and to find a cure!

The Impact of Your Help

Anyone that knows someone that has HD understands how important it is to find a cure and for the millions of people that have never heard of HD it's important to make them aware of this tragic disease. By finding a cure for HD it could easily lead to cures for other diseases like Parkinson's, Alzheimer's and Dementia. 

HD does not have that big household name attached to it like Michael J. Fox and Parkinson's or Lou Gehrig and ALS. The most famous person to have HD is legendary folk artist Woody Guthrie and while many people don't know his name almost everyone has heard his song "This Land is you Land". 

  • With $2 or $2500 you are personally investing in making a difference in helping to find a cure. No matter what you can do your help becomes priceless. 
  • The awareness and the money raised will go along way in having a long term impact in the fight against HD and for finding a cure. The research facility at Vanderbilt University is making a lot of progress in its research in HD and the donations you make could lead to that big break through that we are all looking for. Please help us in this battle!
  • Helping others will always make you feel good!
  • All donations towards finding a cure and raising awareness!

You Can Help Us In Other Ways

We understand that not everyone can help financially but there are other ways you can help.
  • Tell EVERYONE you know about what we are doing!
  • If you know anyone that works at a Radio Station, Television Network, Newspaper, an on line media outlet or any other forms of media that can helps us with getting a news story or interview about what we are doing, we would love to hear from you.
  • Come join me on your bike for any distance you would like to ride.
  • If you know any corporate sponsors that help us reduce our expenses so more funds go to Huntington's Disease research.
  • Tell EVERYONE you know about what we are doing! (It's so important I thought I should say it again)
  • Please share on Facebook, Twitter or any other social media outlet.
THANK YOU for all of your help and support!

story:
A Health Education and Lifestyle Center For Haiti.

“Healthy” Lifestyle Choices Global Institute (HLCGI), a Non-Profit 501 c3 organization, will establish a Health Education and Lifestyle Center in Haiti, where Lifestyle Intervention with Natural Remedy Therapies  are use to prevent Lifestyle Induced Diseases before a higher level of acute care is needed.


Healthy Lifestyle Choices Global Institute,  President

My name is Ervin Davis, M.D. I am a Lifestyle Intervention Specialist, that use reliable scientifically-based Natural Remedy Therapies in the prevention and reversal of lifestyle induced diseases.  My passion is providing health education, disease prevention, lifestyle improvement strategies that are cost effective and readily available. When this approach is used, we see great benefits in health, which saves lives and healthcare dollars annually. 

“Prevention is better than Cure”. Worldwide many people die of lifestyle induced diseases that are wholly preventable (diabetes, hypertension, cancer, cardiovascular diseases, obesity, etc.). This situation is worst in second and third world countries where prevention education and/or medical care are limited or non-existent.We use a very simple and practical approach!


The Haitian Health Education and Lifestyle Center 

The Haitian Health Education and Lifestyle Center model will be unique in that it places an emphasis on the prevention of lifestyle induced diseases using natural remedy therapies through a practical educational approach that demonstrates the principle, “Prevention is better than Cure”.  Our health team’s effort is not simply to cure the immediate malady, but to instruct the individual/community in the basic principles of wellness and prevention and generate an enthusiasm to carry out these principles in future living. We offer a spiritual dimension that is designed to furnish the individual/community an incentive to live in harmony with health and physical laws, and find release from the tensions of life now and eternally. What we teach can be carried home and applied.

The property for this facility has already been acquired. It is located twenty minutes outside of Cap Haitien, a city of 190,000 inhabitants. It is the capital of the State/Department of Nord. The facility will be located in the Lagosette section. This location is conducive for agricultural pursuits which is a part of the training.

Here is what we need! 

We need $53,000 to complete this project. This includes compleing the structure assistance for the medical ministry that provides the essential health education, disease prevention, lifestyle improvement training.

Health and Medical Lifestyle Intervention Continues

Health education and lifestyle intervention training for the center is accomplished by the HLCGI teams for a one or two year period of time. At the end of one year, local health/medical/education team will continue to providing lifestyle intervention treatment and prevention education for Lifestyle diseases. HLCGI’s will continue its involvement as a permanent board member. With this method a continued influx of resource will not be needed without seeing an appreciable benefit.


What Do You  Receive:

As a sponsor/contributor, here’s what you receive: 

(1) A book entitled “Vaccine Alternatives”: How to Prevent and Treat Illness Using Natural Remedies, An Essential Guide for Patients, Parents, Travelers, and Healthcare Workers

(2) An International Internship/Mission Trip Experience in Haiti. Individuals, families, students and other professionals in all disciplines are welcome. Some institutions (high schools/college/university) offer credits for this experience.  Participants will assist in launching the Health Education and Lifestyle Center.

(3) The satisfaction of knowing that your sponsorship/contribution is cost effective and making a significant long-term impact in the lives of many others.

(4) Sponsors/contributors will receive annual reports and Lifestyle center update and may travel to the sites.

The Impact

Over the past twenty years we have seen the benefits of lifestyle intervention training. This prevention first approach will have an impact upon healthcare cost and benefit the individuals and communities in Haiti.

story:
Who are METU Unicorns?

We are a Turkish quidditch team founded in March 2014. This January, we have joined forces with our rivals METU Hippogriffs and got 3rd place at "Tournoi international de la violette" hosted by Toulouse Muggle Quidditch in Toulouse, France, surprising most of Europe. And on the 1st of March we have won the first ever Turkish Quidditch Cup and qualified for the European Quidditch Cup. Now we want to show everyone we mean business by going to the EQC on 18-19 April and aim for the top spot in Europe!



Why do we need your help?

Our team is composed of mostly students, and travel costs can be really high for us considering we are also out of the EU zone. Here is the approximate costs for travelling to Oxford from Ankara:

Travel Costs(return included): 

                      Bus ticket from Ankara to İstanbul: 42€

                      Plane ticket from İstanbul to London: 150€

                      Train ticket from London to Oxford: 48€

Visa Costs(compulsory for everyone):

                      British visa for Turkish citizens: 114€

Accomodation Costs:

                      2 nights at hostel according to the EQC website: 52€

Total Minimum Cost per player: 408€ 

We want to bring our whole squad (21 players) to the EQC but can go with a minimum of 16 people squad so we will need at least 6528€. 


Let's Go to Europe!

With the help and persuasion of our quid-friends that we made in France and all around the world, we want to make this dream true and conquer the European Quidditch Cup. We believe, as the Unicorns, that we have the capability to contribute to quidditch in the world and write our names in the history of quidditch with golden letters. The unique contributions that each of our supporters will provide are more than precious for us Unicorns. By helping us not only will you have the pride and fun of being a real-life badass unicorn, but also your name will be remembered as ours will in the history of quidditch. That's how much we trust our team, and that's why we're sure that your unique contribution will always be remembered!


Quid-date Candidates!


Kamil Urgun & Can Kaytaz

Kaan Bolat

Melike Balkan

Halis Yılmaz

Cansu Bozkurt

Ruşen Sarı

Fatih Aykurt


Ekin Eroğul

Fatih Koşar

Ahmet Can Karakadılar


         

You will feel comfy and fabulous in these hoodies.


We recruited half the team by baking cakes, and yes it tastes as good as it looks.


You can have your bracelets in your team colors, this is a Quercs one for example.


Quidditch and beer? Hell yeah!


We know you want it! The ultimate jersey can be yours at last!


What If?

If we cannot achieve the fund we are aiming, we may not be able to go there with our full squad and that may result in a relatively worse performance. We, beyond anyone, trust each other and our team for sure but there's no harm in appearing at our first EQC tournament with our full strength. That's why we need full support from anyone around and everyone aware of this campaign. Please help us turn the EQC into the most fabulous tournament in the history of European Quidditch.


Other Ways You Can Help

You don't necessarily need to pay, you can always share our indiegogo campaign from your social network accounts or just tell people about the Unicorns, that's what we can ask and that's fabulous enough for us folks.

story:
Hi, my name is Vick (34yrs old). I am a self employed driving instructor living and working in London UK. And as many of you at my age, I only have one living parent; my mother died of stage 4 ovarian cancer which spread to her brain in 2009.

This campaign is an attempt to raise funds to cover the substantial medical costs (including an air ambulance service use) incurred over the last six weeks (Just before Christmas 2014) for my dad who has tragically suffered a very serious injury to his spinal column, leaving him without the use of his arms and legs and currently on a ventilator to keep him alive.

My dad (Danny, a UK citizen for 40yrs and only 66yrs old) has recently been flown back to the UK after being diagnosed with quadriplegia (no use of arms or legs).
He flew to his place of birth (Mauritius) to visit his very sick mother and to deal with some paperwork. His trip was to be short (only 8 days).

After a sleep, on his first day there after a tiring 14 hour flight he woke and got up from bed and fainted.
When he fell he fractured his spine and compressed his spinal column from his neck down through the vertebrae that deals with his respiratory system.

2 hours before being discovered his condition worsened and deteriorated further during the additional 2 hours it took for the ambulance to arrive.
After being neglected in a state hospital for 5 days unwashed and uncared for his brother had him transferred to a private clinic while he still had a small amount of dignity left.

An operation was performed (at the private clinic) however, this operation should have taken place within 6 hours of the accident and by now was 6 days overdue.
At this point his respiratory system started to fail and he was put on a ventilator to breathe for him.

By now the operation (£20,000) was more about saving his life than it was to treat his quadriplegia and while saving his life was a success, the chances of recovering from this condition have become very slim. 

We (my brother and I) initially paid daily for the hospital (approx £1,000 a day), staff and all medical equipment which amounted to around £65,000. 
Much of dad's life savings will have paid for the bulk of the costs because, unfortunately he had not taken out travel insurance. As you can see the costs incurred are huge.
My dad does not have a living will (nobody expects the worse I guess) so the stress involved trying to access his life savings and pension was beyond anything I could have ever expected. This tragedy became all about paying the bills and having no time to care for and be there to support my dad in his time of need.

We tried so hard to get him transported to the UK as quickly as possible and into our free health care system but, we came up against obstacles at every turn.

At first he wasn't stable enough for flight because of the amount of oxygen needed to keep him alive and the use of dopamine aboard a flight is prohibited.
When stable an air ambulance was possible but would have cost in excess of £75,000 something that was beyond our budget even with access to my dads life savings.

There was a commercial flight option which is what we finally managed to achieve (costing £25,000), after overcoming many obstacles and jumping through hoops.
First of all the only airline to fly nonstop and has the capability of transporting a stretcher case is Air Mauritius however, their list of approved medical equipment was a decade out of date and they would not approve the UK medical team's equipment on board.

A doctor from the private clinic went beyond the call of duty and arranged meetings with Air Mauritius and the flight regulatory commission and got them to accept and approve the updated list of equipment and not just a temporary measure for my dad, but for all future cases!
Now all of this took many weeks, we were taking time off from work and my brother had to leave his 18 month old son at home while we traveled across the world to help arrange things in a developing Third World country where things are very slow moving.

My dad is now back in the UK, it has been a week now (1st Feb 2015) and is receiving NHS care. We have all but depleted my dads accounts and are looking into selling his house to help cover costs.

We are not sure what future care will look like and I am hoping that some of you reading this might be able to help us with information regarding ongoing treatment and rehabilitation and possibly the funding of such services.  I am assuming that we will eventually need equipment to transport him and a place for him to live that has been adapted for his condition.

For those of you not able to contribute financially, maybe you know people that can help? He needs a specialised hospital bed in a hospital able to deal with his condition (dad is currently in a general hospital ICU). Maybe you know a surgical consultant who can check his condition and maybe make suggestions to us, the family? Or anything else that you can think of that might help.

If this campaign is not for you, I understand but please take something away with you that we learnt the hard way. Always, always get travel insurance! It may seem simple but you never know and it's a very small cost in comparison if the worse does happen. Also you may have a WILL all ready to go in the case of your death but, get a LIVING WILL! this will help those family members in a situation if you are rendered incapable of moving and talking.

Finally, thank you for increasing awareness of our situation, and all help given. We are eternally grateful.

story:
You can check our website at www.dmt4cpr.com 

Summary

Imagine your loved one underwent a heart attack, suffered a stroke, lays in coma after an accident, or got electrocuted while changing a light bulb and the doctors are telling you they wish if they had more time to save their life. This project is for those who have gone through something similar, know well how it feels losing critical minutes, and for those who think ahead and want to be in a better position if something fatal happens to them or around them. Imagine, that the rescue comes from a scheduled drug: dimethyltryptamine (DMT)! 

We are a group of basic and clinical researchers who follow the line of investigation started by Stephen Szara's groundbreaking clinical studies with DMT. We are among the first ones who broke away of the mainstream scientific view of DMT as a psychopathological agent and proposed a somatophysiological role for this endogenous tryptamine, which is naturally occurring in the body. Our main tenet is that DMT is involved in the healing and regeneration of cells, it helps the body to survive extreme stress like clinical death. Our group has already provided experimental support of this concept in the field of immunology.

The core of present proposal is that one of the physiological roles of endogenous DMT is protection against oxidative stress (e.g., hypoxia, lack of oxygen). Clinical death represents the most severe hypoxic condition and quickly progresses into terminal death. The reversible period of clinical death is limited by the brain's tolerance of oxidative stress what DMT may improve. If our hypothesis is right, than DMT has the potential to extend the survival of brain in clinical death. The ultimate goal (our dream) is to have DMT ampoules for intravenous use on the crash carts of emergency vehicles, intensive care units and operating rooms. The first experimental step towards this goal involves neuronal tissue cultures exposed to hypoxic (low oxygen) condition. We need your support to expand our work into hypoxia studies, which are in the stage of in vitro ("test tube") phase.

It is important to note that we are seeking funding for basic research. We will not be proceeding to human studies until we have got supporting basic data and obtained the requisite permits. Nevertheless, even the first positive results will help rescheduling DMT by falsifying the "no medical use" classification!

When, in 1961, I was working in Julius Axelrod’s lab, one day, I remember Julie showing me the results of his latest experiment on rabbit lung tissues. He found an enzyme capable of synthesizing DMT from its natural precursors. Ever since we kept wondering what could DMT be doing in the lungs, besides being sent to the brain to produce spectacular hallucinations? Some 50 years later DMT was found to bind to sigma-1 receptors which are present in many cells of the body (including the lungs). These receptors are involved in a number of bio-regulatory functions in cells. Dr. Frecska and his colleagues were among the firsts to recognize that DMT, possibly mediated through sigma-1 receptors may be involved in the healing and regeneration processes after severe stress. His group deserves a chance to follow up, with the help of our support, their research using traditional scientific methods.

                                                                                         by Stephen Szára, M.D., D.Sc.                                                                                         Retired Chief of Biomedical Branch,NIDA

Why does the human body and brain make DMT? No one really knows, but it must have a function or more likely multiple functions. Dr. Frecska and his colleagues are on the absolute cutting edge of efforts to understand those functions in depth. Their study will focus on DMT's possible role as an antihypoxic agent in clinical death. The implications of this research, if their hypotheses holds up, are enormous. I strongly urge you to contribute generously to their Indiegogo campaign. This is about an attempt to answer some of the most fundamental questions of the human brain, mind, and spirit. Watch the video and scroll down for a pretty good picture of their research and the questions they are exploring. And then give what you can.

This is possibly the most important DMT research to happen since Rick Strassman forced open the gates 20 years ago!

                                                                                  by Dennis McKenna, Ph.D.                    
                                                            author of The Brotherhood of the Screaming Abyss

Dr. Frecska and his team are doing incredibly important work with DMT, one of the most interesting molecules known to science. Their work goes beyond the psychedelic effects of DMT into the mysteries of its endogenous production in the human body and it's potential role in saving life during the crucial moments in the emergency room before reversible 'clinical death' become irreversible terminal death.

I'm happy to have supported this exciting project and I hope others will do so to. Small donations given by enough people can make all the difference....

                                                                                        by Graham Hancock                    
                                                                                      author of Supernatural

This DMT study by Ede Frecska and Attila Szabo may be an important step in overcoming prejudices constructed on poor ground, showing that traditional sacred medicines may act simultaneously on many levels. This project deserves attention and support from the large community of people who have been touched by the mystery of these medicines.

I second the opinion what Dennis McKenna stated above about the significance of this project.

                                                                              by Luis Eduardo Luna, Ph.D., Dr.H.C.                                                                                               author of Ayahuasca Visions

Dr. Ede Frecska and his colleagues have put forward an intriguing possibility regarding the endogenous substance DMT, also a fascinating psychedelic agent. I do not have the expertise to comment on the probability of their thesis being proven, but, knowing Dr. Frecska's professional integrity and inquisitive mind, I am happy to support the project and to urge others to do so.

                                                                                            by Gabor Maté, M.D.                                                                                                       author of In the Realm of Hungry Ghosts

The hallucinogen paradigm of DMT has been eclipsed with new models based on multilevel adaptive functions enhanced by DMT. This research on DMT's roles in the body may open new frontiers for lifesaving treatments.

                                                                                by Michael Winkelman, M.P.H., Ph.D.                                                                                           co-editor of Psychedelic Medicine

Oxidative stress is an emerging platform in explanation of a wide array of contemporary illnesses. For example: diabetes, obesity, arteriosclerosis, osteoarthritis, Alzheimer's disease, Parkinson's disease, depression with a long list of illnesses of civilization, If DMT is proven to mitigate its effect then we will learn how ayahuasca works as medicine at the molecular level, which is the basic layer in her complex therapeutic effects.

                                                                                                    by Eli Kolp, M.D.                                                                                                             contributor in Psychedelic Medicine

Our team

Dr. Ede Frecska
https://www.researchgate.net/profile/Ede_Frecska
Dr. Attila Szabo
http://www.researchgate.net/profile/Attila_Szabo4


Discretion

All backers have the option to remain anonymus.

Our $100 Perk

Check out our 100% cotton T-shirt design, with the "DMT for CPR" logo. Our perk contains one t-shirt, you choose is it black or white:



Our $200 Perk

Anderson Debernardi's painting "Sinfonía Chamánica" on A3 paper print:

This perk is limited to 100 prints.

Rationale of the Proposed Study
story_txt:
You can check our website at www.dmt4cpr.com SummaryImagine your loved one underwent a heart attack, suffered a stroke, lays in coma after an accident, or got electrocuted while changing a light bulb and the doctors are telling you they wish if they had more time to save their life. This project is for those who have gone through something similar, know well how it feels losing critical minutes, and for those who think ahead and want to be in a better position if something fatal happens to them or around them. Imagine, that the rescue comes from a scheduled drug: dimethyltryptamine (DMT)! 
We are a group of basic and clinical researchers who follow the line of investigation started by Stephen Szara's groundbreaking clinical studies with DMT. We are among the first ones who broke away of the mainstream scientific view of DMT as a psychopathological agent and proposed a somatophysiological role for this endogenous tryptamine, which is naturally occurring in the body. Our main tenet is that DMT is involved in the healing and regeneration of cells, it helps the body to survive extreme stress like clinical death. Our group has already provided experimental support of this concept in the field of immunology. 

The core of present proposal is that one of the physiological roles of endogenous DMT is protection against oxidative stress (e.g., hypoxia, lack of oxygen). Clinical death represents the most severe hypoxic condition and quickly progresses into terminal death. The reversible period of clinical death is limited by the brain's tolerance of oxidative stress what DMT may improve. If our hypothesis is right, than DMT has the potential to extend the survival of brain in clinical death. The ultimate goal (our dream) is to have DMT ampoules for intravenous use on the crash carts of emergency vehicles, intensive care units and operating rooms. The first experimental step towards this goal involves neuronal tissue cultures exposed to hypoxic (low oxygen) condition. We need your support to expand our work into hypoxia studies, which are in the stage of in vitro ("test tube") phase. 

It is important to note that we are seeking funding for basic research. We will not be proceeding to human studies until we have got supporting basic data and obtained the requisite permits. Nevertheless, even the first positive results will help rescheduling DMT by falsifying the "no medical use" classification!

When, in 1961, I was working in Julius Axelrod’s lab, one day, I remember Julie showing me the results of his latest experiment on rabbit lung tissues. He found an enzyme capable of synthesizing DMT from its natural precursors. Ever since we kept wondering what could DMT be doing in the lungs, besides being sent to the brain to produce spectacular hallucinations?  Some 50 years later DMT was found to bind to sigma-1 receptors which are present in many cells of the body (including the lungs). These receptors are involved in a number of bio-regulatory functions in cells. Dr. Frecska and his colleagues were among the firsts to recognize that DMT, possibly mediated through sigma-1 receptors may be involved in the healing and regeneration processes after severe stress. His group deserves a chance to follow up, with the help of our support, their research using traditional scientific methods. 
                                                                                         
by Stephen Szára, M.D., D.Sc. 
                                                                                        
Retired Chief of Biomedical Branch,NIDA

Why does the human body and brain make DMT? No one really knows, but it must have a function or more likely multiple functions. Dr. Frecska and his colleagues are on the absolute cutting edge of efforts to understand those functions in depth. Their study will focus on DMT's possible role as an antihypoxic agent in clinical death. The implications of this research, if their hypotheses holds up, are enormous. I strongly urge you to contribute generously to their Indiegogo campaign. This is about an attempt to answer some of the most fundamental questions of the human brain, mind, and spirit. Watch the video and scroll down for a pretty good picture of their research and the questions they are exploring. And then give what you can.

This is possibly the most important DMT research to happen since Rick Strassman forced open the gates 20 years ago! 
                                                                                 
by Dennis McKenna, Ph.D.
                                                                               
author of The Brotherhood of the Screaming Abyss

Dr. Frecska and his team are doing incredibly important work with DMT, one of the most interesting molecules known to science. Their work goes beyond the psychedelic effects of DMT into the mysteries of its endogenous production in the human body and it's potential role in saving life during the crucial moments in the emergency room before reversible 'clinical death' become irreversible terminal death.

I'm happy to have supported this exciting project and I hope others will do so to. Small donations given by enough people can make all the difference....
                                                                                        
by Graham Hancock
                                                                                                        
author of Supernatural

This DMT study by Ede Frecska and Attila Szabo may be an important step in overcoming prejudices constructed on poor ground, showing that traditional sacred medicines may act simultaneously on many levels. This project deserves attention and support from the large community of people who have been touched by the mystery of these medicines.

I second the opinion what Dennis McKenna stated above about the significance of this project.
                                                                             
by Luis Eduardo Luna, Ph.D., Dr.H.C. 
                                                                                              
author of Ayahuasca Visions

Dr. Ede Frecska and his colleagues have put forward an intriguing possibility regarding the endogenous substance DMT, also a fascinating psychedelic agent. I do not have the expertise to comment on the probability of their thesis being proven, but, knowing Dr. Frecska's professional integrity and inquisitive mind, I am happy to support the project and to urge others to do so.
                                                                                           
by Gabor Maté, M.D. 
                                                                                                      
author of In the Realm of Hungry Ghosts

The hallucinogen paradigm of DMT has been eclipsed with new models based on multilevel adaptive functions enhanced by DMT. This research on DMT's roles in the body may open new frontiers for lifesaving treatments.
                                                                               
by Michael Winkelman, M.P.H., Ph.D. 
                                                                                         
co-editor of Psychedelic Medicine

Oxidative stress is an emerging platform in explanation of a wide array of contemporary illnesses. For example: diabetes, obesity, arteriosclerosis, osteoarthritis, Alzheimer's disease, Parkinson's disease, depression with a long list of illnesses of civilization, If DMT is proven to mitigate its effect then we will learn how ayahuasca works as medicine at the molecular level, which is the basic layer in her complex therapeutic effects.
                                                                                                   
by Eli Kolp, M.D. 
                                                                                                           
contributor in Psychedelic Medicine

Our team

story:
We are Alan Mailloux (Baker Boy) and Barb McMahon (Shop Girl) and we love bread. Good, fresh, made-from-scratch with quality ingredients, a long slow rise and lots of passion, bread.

Alan started experimenting with baking his own bread way back in the early days of our marriage (otherwise known as The Dawn of Time). That little hobby led to Alan studying at the Stratford Chef School. He’s worked in kitchens around the province and we’ve run our own B&B. But we always go back to the bread.

In August of 2011, we opened Downie Street Bakehouse in an abandoned hotel in Stratford, Ontario.


At the time, we were thrilled with all the light-filled space we had. We set to work, just the two of us, baking our hand-shaped, artisanal and specialty breads and bringing them to our customers. Because of our location outside the downtown core, we knew we’d have to go where the people are. We now sell at three Farmer’s Markets year-round with a fourth one in the summer. Life is intense and exciting.

And our business has grown. Last April we hired our first full-time employee. Then we bought a baguette roller. Alan keeps buying rolling racks for the dough to rest on as it’s rising (we call it ‘going to the spa’).

It began to dawn on us that we need more space! Which, thank you to all our wonderful customers, is a great problem to have.

We are still the only tenants in our abandoned hotel, so we have room to expand. We took possession of what will be our new retail space March 1 and we will take possession of the new bake space on April 1. We’re planning to be here for a good long time, having just signed a five-year lease with a five-year option to renew.

We’re inviting you along for the adventure of fixing up these spaces, and buying an extra set of ovens (with a loader to save Alan’s shoulders) and another walk-in fridge (more room for the loaves to have their spa time). This expansion will allow us to hire a part-time shop assistant, with an eye to more staff as we continue to grow.

We’re hoping to raise $20,000 + over the next 35 days.

But we are moving ahead no matter what and will honour every contribution we receive.

We’re asking for your help because we have learned that a bakery is more than a business. It’s a community. Our customers become our friends. This is a huge adventure for us and we want to give you the chance to be a part of it.

Please check out our perks. We had a lot of fun coming up with that list! Know that we are grateful for every single contribution we receive.

Special Perk for the First Twenty-Five to Contribute

The first twenty-five people to make a contribution will be invited to an exclusive private party in our new retail space, catered by the fabulous Wicked Pickle food truck.

Perks for Referrals

Whether you are able to contribute at this time or not (and believe us, we’ve been there!) we want you to know that we appreciate every bit of help you can give us. Referrals will earn perks, too. You will need an Indiegogo account. Then click on the share buttons in the left-hand column of this page. That way, we’ll be able to track your referrals and give you credit for every contribution your friends make. 

Thank you so much!

story:
Every team has fans. Whether you're a small-town little league team, a high school volleyball powerhouse or a semi-pro soccer league, your fans want to keep up with your season. The Scoreboard app from eDriven apps allows anyone to access your team's information, any time, any place.

Scoreboard aims to be a tool that will put coaches of small teams in touch with their fans by enabling them to update scores as they happen through the scoreboard app. This way, fans, parents, and those not able to attend the game can check in on the score at any time!

We believe this app will be put into wide use by little league teams, semi-pro teams, school athletic departments, and more. Small teams wouldn’t be playing if not for the fans that come to see their games. Scoreboard will bring more people in on the game, connecting players with the communities that support them.

Getting scores printed by the local media takes time, and your paper might not cover your team. Coaches can publish their own websites, but it takes skill to build, work to update, and there’s no guarantee that people will come and see it. We aim to make Scoreboard the universal platform for every small team whose statistics go unreported by the media. 


Short Summary

ESPN can't cover every sport, but YOU as the community can keep  up with the teams you love with eDriven Scoreboard.

  • Get the latest scoring information on your favorite teams - no matter the size
  • Can make a game? Get scores the second they happen, right on your phone
  • Enjoy top-notch sport scoring without all the corporate drama

What We Need

How eDriven plans to utilize funds to make Scoreboard great:

  • Easier to use User Interface.  We want you to say "Wow..omg" when you see our app.
  • Reach all platforms; Andriod, iOS, Windows, Mac, Linux, Blackberry
  • Learning Videos -  We'll make it easy for users to manage teams online using high-qualiy video tutorials
  • Marketing - With your help, we can get the word out about Scoreboard. We want every team in America utilizing our solution!

The Impact

The best part of the eDriven Scoreboard app is that we benefit the little guy. We don't have huge endorsements (yet!) from advertisers, meaning we get to focus on what matters - the teams. 

  • For every kid that has a dream of becoming a professional athlete, their journey starts on a  small hometown team. 
  • For every semi-pro team that craves a taste of the "big leagues", the app can help them streamline their processes and unite their fan base.
  • For sports fans everywhere, the eDriven Scoreboard app puts the power in your hands.

Risks & Challenges

Launching an app this size with no budget is a challenge.  We also risk not being able to get to every sport fast enough. We also risk losing stem in the early stages.

  • I am one of these athletes that wishes he had this growing up. My passion will drive this very far.
  • I am recruiting some of the top industry experts to make SCOREBOARD the best it can be.  An expert from every sport will be on our advisory counsel. Developers will also  have a voice as we plan to integrate our software with live physical scoreboards and other services. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Not able to contribute financially? You can still help:

  • Share this campaign with the sports fan in your life - they may be looking for an app just like Scoreboard!
  • Send this link to your kids' sports organizations and coaches. We can help teams of any size get started!
  • Tell your soccer club, flag football or other team about Scoreboard. They maybe looking for this kind of solution. We're happy to get them started!
  • Own a business or know someone that would be interested in sponsoring a team? Connect them with this campaign!

story:
UPDATE! For the next 10 days we have a MATCH CAMPAIGN. For every dollar you give, an anonymous donor has pledged to match you dollar for dollar, up to $500! Give now and double your impact!


WELCOME to the Liberation Mobile! We are raising $5,500 to permanently establish the Ecopsychology portion of this exciting 2-pronged project. Please see below for more details, and contact us with any questions or comments you have. Thank you!


WHAT IS IT?

The Liberation Mobile is the newest project of the largely successful Liberation Institute, a San Francisco-based mental health clinic. This project will consist of a Bay Area-based mobile therapy unit that will serve two primary purposes:

1. A mobile therapy unit that will drive into low-income neighborhoods in San Francisco, Oakland and East Palo Alto, offering direct mental health services to residents in their communities.

2. A vehicle that will take clients out of the inner city and into state and national parks, recreational areas, organic farms and other natural spaces for structured ecopsychology therapy sessions. We are raising $5,500 to establish this part of the larger project.


WHY GIVE?

1. For clients in the Bay Area. The Liberation Institute directly serves the needs of San Francisco's low-income community through its sliding scale payment policy. The vast majority of its clients – 86% - report the Liberation Institute as the only mental health clinic that they are able to access. Of these, 24% have reported that they discontinued therapy due to difficulty getting to the Institute’s offices. In other words, the Liberation Institute is doing a remarkable job of offering affordable and accessible healthcare to clients who wouldn’t otherwise receive it. But, we can do more. The Liberation Mobile enhances the Institute’s accessibility by offering services directly in the communities where people live. And, by taking people out of the city and into natural areas, we are increasing the diversity of therapeutic modalities we are able to offer clients. 

2. For potential clients throughout the country. The Liberation Institute has documented its programming and model for years, knowing that it can be successfully replicated throughout the country. The Liberation Mobile, the Institute's newest project, will be similarly documented for the potential use of organizations throughout the country. We've seen the effects of this model, and know it can spread.

3. For you. The benefits of providing mental healthcare to people who wouldn’t otherwise be able to receive it is a service to us all. By supporting the neediest communities in our cities, we are improving the overall health, safety, and vitality of the places we call home. Healthcare is communal by nature - helping one individual helps the whole.


WHO IS INVOLVED?

The Liberation Mobile is a project of the Liberation Institute, a licensed non-profit 501(c)3 mental health organization that provides sliding scale psychotherapy services to a diverse range of clientele throughout the San Francisco Bay Area. Founded in 2008 by Dr. Stever Dallman, the Liberation Institute currently serves over 200 clients each week, with a staff of over 50 therapists trained in a variety of modalities. It is a truly grassroots organization, dependent on neither private nor public grants for its survival.

Dr. Steven "Stever" Dallmann is the founder and director of the Liberation Institute, and he is one of over 50 therapists at the institute working to provide affordable mental healthcare to clients in the Bay Area. 

Chris Freimuth is a horticulturalist and student at the New York Botanical Garden. As a long-time supporter and member of the Liberation Institute, he is organizing this crowdfunding campaign and contributing the perks. 


A TRACK RECORD OF EXTRAORDINARY SUCCESS!

The Liberation Institute has been serving clients since 2008, with extraordinary results. We can expect success in the Liberation Mobile to mirror that reported in the offices we have already established. According to surveys and analyses of participating clients, the Liberation has achieved the following successes:

· Manage, reduce or alleviate depression by 81%

· Reduce truancy rate for 92% of participating teens

· Manage, improve or support into recovery 68% of addicts and alcoholics

· Connect 92% of clients to additional resources

· Increase self-awareness, health and well-being for 98% of clients


WHERE IS IT?

The Liberation Mobile will serve low-income communities in the cities of San Francisco, Oakland and East Palo Alto, California. 

By initiating this pilot program and essentially writing the manual for this type of therapeutic program, we are confident that this project will eventually be replicated by other therapy and counseling organizations throughout the country.


WHEN WILL IT LAUNCH?

The Liberation Mobile will get rolling in the Spring of 2016!


HOW WILL YOUR CONTRIBUTION MAKE A DIFFERENCE?

The $5,500 that we raise with this campaign will permanently establish the ecopsychology leg of the Liberation Mobile. This money will fund transport, food, insurance and other programming costs to take approximately one dozen clients on four day-long excursions and one full camping trip. Our budget is based on:

· 1 day trip to Golden Gate Park

· 1 day trip to the Marin Headlands

· 1 extended day trip to local organic farms in Sonoma or Grass Valley

· 1 extended day trip to Point Reyes or another local beach

· 1 full on 4-5 day camping trip to the redwoods north of San Francisco

***If we exceed our goal, funding will go to support both aspects of the Liberation Mobile (including the inner city mobile therapy unit)!


PERKS!

To show our gratitude for your generosity, here are the perks we are offering.

$10: Acknowledgment on this Site


$25: A Hand-Made Card


$50: A Card and Pressed Flower


$100: A 5-Pack of Hand-Made Cards


$200: Homemade Apple Butter


$400: Seasonal Wreath


$800: Garden Consultation with Chris


$1,600: Stylized Garden Plan




A VERY special thanks to Nicole Kovski for her invaluable help with this campaign. And many thanks to the countless others who have been integral to the inspiration and execution of this project!

And, by taking people out of the city and into natural areas, we are increasing the diversity of therapeutic modalities we are able to offer clients. 2. For potential clients throughout the country. The Liberation Institute has documented its programming and model for years, knowing that it can be successfully replicated throughout the country. The Liberation Mobile, the Institute's newest project, will be similarly documented for the potential use of organizations throughout the country. We've seen the effects of this model, and know it can spread.3. For you. The benefits of providing mental healthcare to people who wouldn’t otherwise be able to receive it is a service to us all. By supporting the neediest communities in our cities, we are improving the overall health, safety, and vitality of the places we call home. Healthcare is communal by nature - helping one individual helps the whole.WHO IS INVOLVED?The Liberation Mobile is a project of the Liberation Institute, a licensed non-profit 501(c)3 mental health organization that provides sliding scale psychotherapy services to a diverse range of clientele throughout the San Francisco Bay Area. Founded in 2008 by Dr. Stever Dallman, the Liberation Institute currently serves over 200 clients each week, with a staff of over 50 therapists trained in a variety of modalities. It is a truly grassroots organization, dependent on neither private nor public grants for its survival.Dr. Steven "Stever" Dallmann is the founder and director of the Liberation Institute, and he is one of over 50 therapists at the institute working to provide affordable mental healthcare to clients in the Bay Area. Chris Freimuth is a horticulturalist and student at the New York Botanical Garden. As a long-time supporter and member of the Liberation Institute, he is organizing this crowdfunding campaign and contributing the perks. A TRACK RECORD OF EXTRAORDINARY SUCCESS!The Liberation Institute has been serving clients since 2008, with extraordinary results. We can expect success in the Liberation Mobile to mirror that reported in the offices we have already established. According to surveys and analyses of participating clients, the Liberation has achieved the following successes:· Manage, reduce or alleviate depression by 81%· Reduce truancy rate for 92% of participating teens· Manage, improve or support into recovery 68% of addicts and alcoholics· Connect 92% of clients to additional resources· Increase self-awareness, health and well-being for 98% of clientsWHERE IS IT?The Liberation Mobile will serve low-income communities in the cities of San Francisco, Oakland and East Palo Alto, California. By initiating this pilot program and essentially writing the manual for this type of therapeutic program, we are confident that this project will eventually be replicated by other therapy and counseling organizations throughout the country.WHEN WILL IT LAUNCH?The Liberation Mobile will get rolling in the Spring of 2016!HOW WILL YOUR CONTRIBUTION MAKE A DIFFERENCE?The $5,500 that we raise with this campaign will permanently establish the ecopsychology leg of the Liberation Mobile. This money will fund transport, food, insurance and other programming costs to take approximately one dozen clients on four day-long excursions and one full camping trip. Our budget is based on:· 1 day trip to Golden Gate Park· 1 day trip to the Marin Headlands· 1 extended day trip to local organic farms in Sonoma or Grass Valley· 1 extended day trip to Point Reyes or another local beach· 1 full on 4-5 day camping trip to the redwoods north of San Francisco***If we exceed our goal, funding will go to support both aspects of the Liberation Mobile (including the inner city mobile therapy unit)!PERKS!To show our gratitude for your generosity, here are the perks we are offering.
$10: Acknowledgment on this Site$25: A Hand-Made Card

$50: A Card and Pressed Flower


$100: A 5-Pack of Hand-Made Cards
$200: Homemade Apple Butter

$400: Seasonal Wreath


$800: Garden Consultation with Chris


$1,600: Stylized Garden Plan



 
A VERY special thanks to Nicole Kovski for her invaluable help with this campaign. And many thanks to the countless others who have been integral to the inspiration and execution of this project!

story:
Short Summary

My name is JoAnne Chitwood and I am a registered nurse, a certified trauma professional, a certified hospice and palliative care nurse (CHPN), a writer and filmmaker and a trained trauma group leader. Many people find that a current grief experience triggers deeper underlying wounds from much earlier in life. Our center will provide hurting people with opportunities to heal these wounds in a safe and nurturing environment.

I’ve been conducting intensive grief and trauma retreats for years, always using temporarily rented facilities to do so. It is a challenge to create the necessary environment for healing when in someone else’s facility. It’s been my dream for years to have a healing center in which we can do this. Now is the time! Through a series of Providential events, I was led to a gorgeous property outside of Nashville, TN that is perfect for our center. It has a beautiful log lodge and a guest house plus trails for hiking, a lovely pond and a shop for the art projects our attendees do. 

 And you can help make this possible! Your donation to the center will make an immeasurable difference in the lives of many who have been traumatized by life experiences and need to process those hurts in a safe environment. 

Carrie's Story

Carrie came to our Journey of the Heart retreat from Canada. (She gave me permission to tell her story.) She heard we were offering opportunities to work through trauma and her pinched and drawn face told the story of a lot of inner pain. We found out that she had lost her dad in a plane crash when she was only 10 and she had never really come to terms with his death, as his body was never found. 

Then, the year before I met her, she went up for a plane ride with several family members, including her mother’s new husband. Her cousin was the pilot and she rode in the back seat with her aunt. As her cousin went through the sequence of piloting tasks to take off, Carrie fiddled with her headphones, which didn’t seem to be working. She told her cousin she was having trouble with them and he tried to help her, and, in the process, forgot to set the flaps on the plane correctly. 

The plane lifted off, then crashed back down to a log-strewn field only seconds later. Huge downed trees ripped through the cockpit, killing all three of Carrie’s family members in the plane and crushing her right leg so badly it had to be amputated. 

When she regained consciousness, Carrie was horrified to learn about her loved ones’ deaths and even more horrified to discover her missing leg. Only in her mid-twenties, she felt her life was over. Her guilt consumed her and a deep depression set in. Nothing seemed to shake it. That is, until she came to our retreat.

In the retreat, we gave Carrie a chance to tell her story to a caring group. She wept as she told us about how guilty she felt about distracting the pilot and causing her mother to lose her spouse a second time. She felt angry that her leg had been taken while she was unconscious, without her permission. We reenacted the loss with a doll, dressed just as she had been on the day of the crash. Different members of the group became the nurse and the doctor, explaining to her that her leg was crushed and needed to be removed to save her life. She gave permission and the dolls leg was amputated and given to Carrie. 

We all trooped out to the garden where a little grave had been dug for the leg and we had a funeral service for it. We all wept with Carrie as she read a letter aloud that she had written to her lost leg, grieving over all the things she missed because of losing it. Then she placed the doll’s leg in the grave and we all solemnly placed handfuls of dirt over it, hugging her and expressing our sorrow over her loss. 

At the end of the two weeks, Carrie’s face had transformed from ravaged to filled with light and peace and joy. She had found a way to come to terms with tragedy and loss and forgive herself and God. She returned to Canada ready to fully engage in her life.

This is an example of the kinds of experiences that you, with your donation, will be making possible. This is not an isolated story, but a recurring theme of healing and hope. 

What We Need and What You Get

Our need is for the down payment on our retreat center and enough funding to operate for a year while we spread the word about our programs and network in the community and nationally. We need a $300,000 down payment and another $125,000 for a year’s worth of payments on the center. In addition to that, we need $25,000 for getting the word out about our program until word of mouth becomes our most effective advertising tool. Staff salaries will come from the workshop income. 

We will have accommodations for participants to attend from all over the world and expect our reputation to spread by word of mouth as stories like Carrie’s become known. 

The Impact

It's not often that we have the opportunity to contribute something as meaningful to our world today as reducing the level of fear energy being produced on our planet. Each of us that faces and works through the negative energy that is produced by unresolved trauma, contributes to our own health, the health of our family, our society, our nation and our world. Like a pebble tossed in a lake, the ripples of impact go out in an never ending arc. You have a chance to be part of that!

Risks & Challenges

The risks and challenges of creating an environment for healing center around the concept of “resistance.”  Any time you or I move into the arena of creating something new that hasn’t been in existence before this, resistance comes up against us in many forms. The harder we fight to bring our dream into the light of day, the more resistance comes up against us, trying our motivation and testing our very souls. It is a necessary part of the creative process, but many lose heart here and turn back. 

Through the years, in pursuit of this dream of a safe place for processing hurts and trauma, resistance has howled in like a pack of wild dogs, trying to stop me. The dream has been delayed, but the passion for it has never died. The time is now, resistance be damned. (See the perks section for a copy of The War of Art, Stephen Pressfield’s ground breaking book about resistance and the creative process.)

If the funds raised in this campaign are not enough to open the center, your money will be used for scholarships to and the expenses of, Journey of the Heart grief and trauma healing retreats in a rented facility.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren’t able to donate to our center, please consider using the IndieGoGo tools on this site to share our campaign with everyone you know. Your caring support means the world to us and we thank you for it!
